name: Onyx Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: I often stay at a Kimpton Hotel in various cities, second stay here. Love the location, staff excellent, rooms nice but on small side. I love this hotel chain for many reasons, including that they are all different but all excellent!
reviews.title: Kimpton Onyx is a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from 3 nights in Room 1006. The hotel staff is wonderful and make you feel so welcome. Free coffee in the morning and evening wine reception. It is a 10 minute walk to Little Italy and Au Bon Pain is across the street, with a Subway and 7-11 virtually right out the front door. I placed a bid on Priceline and thankfully the Onyx accepted it. Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the North End with the North End prices. The hop on hop off shuttle stops right up the street (2 minute walk) and that will take you to all the tourist attractions - Freedom Trail, Copley Square, Harvard, the Aquarium, the "Constitution". The hotel sells the shuttle tickets and they are good for 2 days! In/Out Valet parking is available as well. We didn't eat in the Ruby Room downstairs but the breakfast buffet smelled wonderful. You won't be sorry - the staff is superb! The beds are little firm - not cushy! Free internet if you join (for free) their Kimpton In Touch program) and a $10 mini bar credit!
reviews.title: Wonderful - STAY HERE!

reviews.text: What can I say about the Onyx Hotel that hasn’t already been said except, thank you!
reviews.title: Onyx, You're On It!

reviews.text: I stayed here for 2 nights, one of the nights the Bruins were playing in the Stanley Cup Finals. Even in the midst of all the chaos, the hotel shined with wonderful customer service and friendliness.
reviews.title: Pleased

reviews.text: The hotel is quiet, clean and well run. Thank you Onyx. I can’t wait to visit again!
reviews.title: Great hotel - would stay again

reviews.text: We arrived the night the Bruins won the stanley cup...The hotel is about 900 feet from the Garden, and a huge awaiting crowd on the streets raised hell until the police gently shut them down around 1 AM, which was about the time we got to sleep. And we all slept well in our adjoining corner rooms 1001 & 1002. The continental breakfast included coffee, juices, yogurt, fruit, cereal, breads & pastries, just enough to get going. If you opt to eat out, there is an Au bon pain bakery accross the street for breakfast, and a Subway 250 feet away, for picnics or late night munchies. The convenience extends to a 7-11 on the corner, and a CVS a block from that, and at least 20 bars, pubs and restaurants in the immediate area of the hotel. The hotel is also close to a T, which we used a lot in our 5 days in Boston, The Charlie Card that allows you to use all MBTA assets within the greater Boston area, (and Salem, Concord, and Lexington) is a great value (kids under 12 free w/adult). Hanover street, heart of the North end, and all that great Italian food is just far enough away to walk off your meal back to the hotel. We had drinks and snacks one night in the Ruby Room, it was nice to have that available on the property
reviews.title: Big Party, Great Rooms, Excellent Service, Super Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The customer service at the hotel was excellent, despite being full to capacity due to the Bruins win and the parade; the staff was always helpful, friendly and professional. On my Birthday I was presented a bucket of Sam Adams', which made the trip even better.
reviews.title: We loved it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms themselves are smaller, pretty much a theme for Boston; but done in muted contrasting colors, with comfy bedding and linens, great TV's, wireless internet, and bathrooms. Most important....we all slept great, this from people who live in the country.
reviews.title: Perfect Location Hands Down

reviews.text: All in all the great location, and great customer service contributed to a memorable stay in Boston. Thanks Hayat, Lauren, the 2 Johns, and all.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel in a Not So Awesome location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel using other trip advisor reviews and we loved it. The staff greeted us with a glass of wine which was very welcome after a long drive. The staff were also very helpful with some of our unusual requests as we had brought our road bikes to do some touring around Boston. They were always gracious.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a long weekend at the Onyx - quick get away for my wife and I. We booked a Penthouse room - very comfy. The staff was super - from arrival thru departure. Knew our names and room number. Always had great recommendations. Good fun people. The valet Paulos was super!! Lauren, John and Michael at the front desk were great too. Fun and very helpful. They definitely make the hotel special. We were treated royally. The location was perfect for walking to the North Side, Boston Common, Quincy Market and the water front, Aquarium, museums, and is right around the corner from the Boston Garden. Definitely wonder the Little Itally for dinner and check out the street festivals. Fun and great food.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff and Location

reviews.text: I stayed at the Onyx this past weekend and felt like a King. Boston is literally at your fingertips from this location, and I would know becuase I am from the area. I attended a cruise of the harbor before going out around the town. Out of the ten plus years I have been going out in Boston that night had to be in the top five expereinces. The Onyx staff was very friendly and helped me with whatever I needed in a timley manner. I've stayed at other hotels in Boston and none of them come close to the style and decour of the Onyx. The Onyx is everything you expext in a hotel and more. The gold fish throughout the hotel is a such a nice touch that leaves you feeling like a rockstar.
reviews.title: Excellent service, accomadations, and style.

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay. Staff were helpful. Great location. Lovely room and bathroom. Love the leopard print bathrobes! Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place for a quick tip to Boston

reviews.text: Great downtown boutique hotel within walking distance to Fanueil Hall and the Garden... Also very close to North Station. They describe themselves as a luxury boutique hotel and I couldn't agree more!
reviews.title: Posh downtown hotel with top notch appeal!

reviews.text: The rooms are on the smaller side but the furnishings are beautiful. Much attention was paid to the small details. The bed was super comfortable- I slept like a baby.
reviews.title: A Perfect 10

reviews.text: I am one of 12 children (incl. "In-Laws") that went to Boston last week to surprise our parents for their 60th Birthdays. We sent them their from Chicago to go to a game at Fenway and Whale Watching. It was a true surprise and they had no idea... it was the first time we were all on vacation together in over 15 years. With us coming from 5 different states across the country to do so... pulling off the surprise was a challenge. Well, the real surprise was the staff at Onyx... THERE WERE FIRST CLASS!!! They were in on the surprise making sure reservations were under untraceable names... we were never spotted... and that it would run flawlessly. They let us know when our parents returned to their room so we could surprise them by singing Happy Birthday outside their door.... and they even took it upon themselves to send up a Bottle of Champaign to the room. I travel a ton and this was the most impressive hotel staff I have ever encountered!!! Thanks to Hayat, John, & especially Lauren... the rest of the staff, and a beautiful hotel in a great location... WE HAD THE VACATION OF A LIFETIME!!! WE THANK YOU!!!
reviews.title: BEST SURPRISE EVER

reviews.text: The Onyx is a wonderful addition to the North Station area. Steps from the trains and North End and Quincy Market. My room was gorgeous and very quiet - didn't hear any noise from the hall during the night, bed was super comfortable and I was greeted with a glass of wine when I walked into the lobby to check in. The desk staff was always smiling and cheerful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great addition to North Station area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I decided to get away for a few days with our dog Oscar, a King Charles Cavalier Spaniel and we could not have had a better time. The staff, most notably John, Lauren, and many of the other workers were amazing, and catered to our every need. Not only that, they truly made Oscar (our little pup) feel welcome and loved and didn't hesitate to take him for walks, lavished him treats, and were even kind enough to take him downstairs while we had room service (where he was the star of the show in reception I gather). I can't thank the staff of the Onyx enough for such a wonderful stay and for making our whole family, especially little Oscar feel welcome. He misses you all and gives a big "rowf!" which means thanks!
reviews.title: Amazing Stay!

reviews.text: We only got to spend one day and one night in Boston, which was the last destination of our whirlwind vacation, but the Onyx staff helped us make the most of it. We checked in after our three-hour whale watching trip, so our 13-year old was understandably tired. We asked our bell-man about restaurants in the area, so he was in the room when my son said he didn't want to go out to dinner with us. When my husband, daughter, and I returned from dinner in the North End (Little Italy--yum!) , we were pleasntly surprised to find that the front desk had sent cookies up to the room for the kids, and cheese and crackers for us. It was a great way to satisfy my son until we got back with dinner for him. The staff at the hotel was so helpful with everything from directions to suggestions on how to get the most out of our limited time. They suggested taking the Old Town Trolley tour, which is exactly what we did. Yes, the rooms are small, but comfortable, and the shower was fantastic!! Although the immediate neighborhood is quiet after 5:00 p.m., the hotel is walking distance to Long Wharf, Quincy Market, Faneuil Hall, and the North End, so that didn't matter to us. I've never met a more thoughtful staff in my travels, and we would definitely stay at the Onyx again.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel Close to Everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff was nothing short of outstnading. They went above and beyond to make sure us and our dogs were well taken care of. The hotel itself is fabulous. Great location and in walking distance of the best of Boston. The attention and kindness the staff paid to us and our dogs can only be described as pheonominal. While most hotels wouldn't even consider having pets, the embraced them with open arms and make you feel that they are honored to have you and your pets stay at their hotel. If ever in Boston again we will book there again. We will now be planning our all of our vacations of where Kimptons have hotels.
reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights at the Boston Onyx Hotel (a Kimpton Hotel) in September and were extremely pleased with this property. It was within walking distance to the Quincy Market and other major Boston attractions. The staff was excellent and very friendly always helpful with any questions we had, and actually a lot of fun! The price was right inline with other Boston hotels and we would definetly stay there again when we return to the area. Our room was on the smallish side but VERY comfortable and Quiet. Loved this Hotel and its staff!! They also offered free wine in our room waiting for us and when we said we did not drink, they sent up Diet Cokes which was terrific-on the house.
reviews.title: Onyx Hotel a Gem in Boston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this for our first trip to Boston (from London). The area is a bit post-industrial in feel, reminding me of the scarier parts of Liverpool or Manchester, but that was just the impression we had arriving after dark, and after a long and tiring journey. Might not suit the elderly (I am 56!). Actually the location is handy, 3 mins from North T station, with a very decent bar (Porter's) next door. If coming from Logan airport, you have one easy change to make.
reviews.title: Smallish, friendly, cool decor

reviews.text: Lively and efficient welcome, with the young and intelligent staff up for 'the craic', which suits me fine. A clean, stylish and comfortable hotel.
reviews.title: A fabulous stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was excellent value: in fact one sandwich with fries was supper for us both. Breakfast a bit pricey; suggest you grab the free coffee or tea and go elsewhere to eat. Free wifi worked well.
reviews.title: Good choice for night out in Boston

reviews.text: This hotel was booked through priceline so it wasn't our choice, but what a find. They didn't have a king room for the whole 5 night stay but they offered us either the larger handicapped twin room or the choice of moving hotel rooms if we wanted a king room for 3 of the 5 nights. We opted to stay in the twin room for the duration. The decor was lovely and the room clean. The leopard print robes finished off the look perfectly. When we rang down on the first morning to ask if we had to collect the coffee from the lobby or did we order it to the room, a coffee machine was bought up and topped up daily.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel as we wanted to be close to the centre of Boston, and everything really is just a short walk (Faneuil) or a quick T-ride (Harvard) or taxi away.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff, great hotel!

reviews.text: The hotel is stylishly comfy in the manner of other Kimpton properties we have stayed at.
reviews.title: great service goes a long way

reviews.text: Our double queen room was a little on the small side for a family of four with luggage in accordance for a 3 week trip all over the USA, but it was very comfortable nonetheless, particularly the beds, which were heavenly.
reviews.title: Class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had to find something negative about the room, it would maybe be that some corners were quite dusty, which is understandable in a room full of furniture ( housekeeping must have trouble moving around with the vaccuum cleaner, I know I would), but not something for 'clean freaks'. Please understand that I am saying 'dusty', and not dirty, as the room was perfectly clean otherwise.
reviews.title: Very confortable rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To get back to the positives, the staff in this hotel are absolutely fantastic ! Our check-in experience was a delight, were always greeted cheerily when entering or leaving the hotel, and when we got caught in a pre-Irene deluge just before we were due to leave for the airport, all of the staff at the front desk stepped in to literally save our sodden souls from what would have been a very cold, miserable & drenched trip to the airport.
reviews.title: Neat little hotel in a convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Onyx for our anniversary. We chose the Onyx because they are pet friendly and the price and location was perfect for us. I booked a Penthouse room for Memorial Weekend and got a great deal (by Boston standards) at $230 a night.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Pet Friendly and Comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, there was a cute sign with a bowl and dog biscuits welcoming our dogs. Check in was prompt and to our surprise they offered us 2 rooms for the price of 1! They had some open rooms for the weekend and since we brought our 2 Great Danes with us, they figured we could use the extra space. We were thrilled.
reviews.title: Excellent Service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we reserved was clean and comfortable. The bed was plush and we got a great sleep. Since I had put in my reservation that it was our anniversary, they left us a complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolates which was a nice treat!
reviews.title: Another Great Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: The second room, which we got complimentary, had a pull out sofa bed (no regular bed). The room was large, with a little seating area, a sink and bathroom. I’m not sure I’d want to stay in this room but it was great for our dogs.
reviews.title: Great hotel with phenomenal service!

reviews.text: The staff was very helpful. They offered us maps and asked if we needed recommendations – we didn’t take them up on these things though since we’re quite familiar with Boston. I also called down to request bowls because we forgot to pack ours and they promptly brought us two.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel and staff.

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights at the Onyx Hotel in July, and upon arrival you felt like you were at home.The staff always friendly and ready to help you in any way.The room we got was very clean, the washroom was spotless.The bedsheets were fresh and crisp.The room also has a safe which I find very pratical. Location is good, within walking distance to Fanueil Hall and the North End (LITTLE ITALY), and close to a T-stop.One block away from the TD GARDENS.
reviews.title: YOU ALWAYS KNOW WHEN YOUR AT A KIMPTON HOTEL... HIP & friendly

reviews.text: The complementary wine hour at the Kimpton Hotels is always a treat.
reviews.title: do not stay here

reviews.text: Would recomend the Onyx to anyone looking for a great staffed hotel in Boston.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay at the Onyx, great service!

reviews.text: This hotel is not in a good spot in Boston...You can not walk to attractions. The rooms are so small that you feel trapped!! The worst part is that the service is totally lacking... No valet out front...You have to leave your car and walk into the hotel to find someone to help you...Front desk not very helpful. We had asked for a late checkout so that we could sleep in. The front desk did not tell the maid about the late check out so the maid stormed into our room with one quick knock then opened the door around 10. I informed the front desk who didn't seem to really care....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! Your money will be better spent somewhere else!!!!
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff couldn't fault it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to give the Onyx a 4.5. It's clean, mostly quiet, and fun in the Kimpton way. There were well-behaved dogs in the lobby and the staff was always happy to do anything they could to make our one night stay pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were no problems, but I found room 1008 to be really small, I thought the HVAC system was noisy, and parking seemed expensive at $42/night. I liked the Marlowe (another nearby Kimpton property) more and if I could choose between the two, the Marlowe would win.
reviews.title: Just like the W

reviews.text: Having said that, the Onyx is convenient to the North End and to the Faneuil Hall area, and it's easy to drive to and from this hotel, so it's a good bet for tourists. The neighborhood is noisy and not Boston's most impressive, but it's not bad either. If you're thinking of coming to Boston as a tourist for a few days, here's how to get the most out of the Onyx:
reviews.title: Our new favorite spot in Beantown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, join Kimpton's free InTouch program. You'll get email telling you when there's a sale and when there is, make reservations fast because rooms don't last long. And wi-fi is free if you're an InTouch member. Now see if there's anything happening at the nearby Fleet Center (aka TD Garden). You're staying nearby so check it out. If you like Italian food, make reservations for dinner in Boston's North End. We went to Marco and it was amazing. Stay 2 or 3 nights, and let the staff at the Onyx help you decide what to do. As long as you don't mind the small room, you'll love it.
reviews.title: List every positive adjective in the dictionary here!!!

reviews.text: Okay, this should be a five-star review, right? If this was a regular hotel, I'd easily say yes. But this is a Kimpton and they've spoiled me over the last 15 years so I expect a lot. By Kimpton standards, the Onyx is actually sort of average. But Kimpton's average is pretty amazing and there was nothing they could have done better, so I'm going to call it excellent.
reviews.title: Holy cannoli! I've never been treated with such amazing customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are loyal members of the Kimpton chain but this hotel by far has been the worst experience. We were staying on the 9th floor and could every conversation coming from the room next door. I even had earplugs in and it was non-stop til 3am! The staff was gracious enough to try and get them to keep it quiet but to no avail. The next night of our stay we requested a move and was moved up to the penthouse level. It was great for a while but after 1am, our neighbors next door decided to have a party. They were even playing around with the joining room door trying to open it. Up all night and then awoken again at 9am with the frat boys next door. The location is great and the customer service is fantastic but if you want to sleep, forget about it. The Nine Zero is better.
reviews.title: Walls are too thin!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As the proud parents of a fuzzy four-legged canine "son", we are constantly looking for good dog-friendly hotel options while on road trips from Toronto. The Onyx did not disappoint!
reviews.title: Perfect Stay - Our Dog Loved It Too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love a good 8-10 hour road trip but few hotels welcome dogs. A handful of chains do, but don't truly make for a dog-friendly experience. In such establishments, owners need to be present in the room with the dogs or have to crate them while out for dinner. Anyone reading this who has a dog will know that crating a dog for a couple of hours isn't ideal in an "outside of the home" environment.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: ALONG COMES KIMPTON! YAY!
reviews.title: Perfect location if you're going to the Gah-den

reviews.text: We learned about Kimpton's dog-friendly services online and researched them here on TripAdvisor and are so glad we did! Our experience at the hotel was amazing!
reviews.title: Location a plus (and a minus)

reviews.text: This was by far the very best hotel I have stayed in! The service was outstanding....extremely accommodating and helpful in every way. The guys at the front desk were professional and adorable in every way! The location is so convenient and accessible to great restaurants and attractions! 5 stars!
reviews.title: Amazingly Awesome!

reviews.text: Stayed at Onyx for an evening in August, it is centrally located and within walking distance to Quincy Market, Union Oyster House, Faneuil Hall (all roughly a 5-10 minute walk). Rooms were clean, beds were firm and comfortable, staying in a DElux King bed room on the 4th Floor(402). Room was a bit cramped but didnt bother us as we were using the room to simply sleep. Bathroom was nice and spacious. There is no view except of neighboring rooms through your window. I am not sure I would have paid the full asking price for this hotel given the option (booked this through Sneaqaway) but all in all a positive experiance. Would reccomend if you are spending the day/night in Boston.
reviews.title: Good Location, Cramped Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't understand how people can knock this hotel even the least bit. You get:
reviews.title: Stayed for the 4th of July and loved it!

reviews.text: - Free WiFi (it actually worked, and wasn't slow!)
reviews.title: Comfy, but customer service needs some help

reviews.text: - Programmable A/C unit that actually works
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, good location at a reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Onyx primarily due to its super-convenient location one block from TD Garden. After experiencing the warm hospitality, the comfortable beds, and the surrounding neighborhood, we will be back! We were greeted warmly every time we entered the hotel. The staff was quick to suggest things to make us more comfortable, such as an umbrella if it looked like rain. We were on the penthouse floor and our room was a good size and it was very quiet. It was a quick walk to the North End and convenient to public transportation. The Wi-fi was the best we have encountered in a hotel anywhere---as good as our home wi-fi. This was our first stay in a Kimpton and we will return!
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Onyx for 1 night in November and cannot say enough about the property. We were able to check in early as we had reservations for an event at 3pm .
reviews.title: Loved the Onyx Hotel- Will definitely be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lauren, at the front desk, was so accommodating and helpful through out our stay. She is a great example of how customers should be treated. The Onynx provides personalized, friendly service that I do not usually find at other hotels.
reviews.title: Right On, Onyx!

reviews.text: The room was great, beds comfortable, and immaculate clean.
reviews.title: Ideal Location, Friendly Service in Boston

reviews.text: The location is great if you want to explore the city on foot. The complimentary coffee in morning is a great "perk".
reviews.title: Easy Stay at the Onyx

description: Onyx Hotel, a luxury boutique hotel in historic downtown Boston, offers exceptional service in stylish surroundings. This gem of a hotel is situated on a charming side street within walking distance of the Boston TD Garden (Fleet Center), Bunker Hill, the Freedom Trail, Faneuil Hall and North Station. The notable neighborhood is harmoniously met with the old-world hospitality of this Kimpton Hotel. The mesmerizing Ruby Room lounge adds to the bejeweled ambiance.
